text: Saint Joan is a play by George Bernard Shaw about the life of Joan of Arc. It was written in 1923. ==Story== The play is about Joan of Arc, a French teenager who helped to unite her people to fight against the English in the Hundred Years' War. ==About the play== The play was written in 1923. This was three years after Joan of Arc became a saint in the Catholic Church. Shaw showed Joan as smart, kind, and real. He said that the play has no villains, and is about what people do when they are trying their best. The play has six parts and an ending (called an epilogue) that show different parts of Joan of Arc's life. == References == Category:Plays by George Bernard Shaw Category:1920s works
